channel.title: [PI] Killing an npc makes the server crash

item.title: [PI] Killing an npc makes the server crash
item.dc:creator: @Pkor159 Pkor159
item.description:
@Pkor159 wrote:

nvm… looking at the error really does help.
The penance queen was used as monster in the BarbarianDefence minigame. My source had it but i didn’t know.
Changing the npc id in the minigame.java fixed it.
Regardless, thank you

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Killing an npc makes the server crash
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Pkor159, post:12, topic:535748”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=654555.msg4384705#msg4384705 date=1384898539]

So you need the void?

That’d be the method, yes.
[/quote]
I don’t think giving you the method would help since there’s nothing in it just two ints and cases.
It doesn’t just happen with the penance queen it happens with nomad too. (But with nomad it’s when i hit him).
their both attack and death animations are good i tried killing them on another base it worked good.
Maybe i should give you some methods in the Npc .java?[/quote]

No, really, telling us the method really helps because that way we know what’s causing the issue.

When your server errors, what’s the console look like? Post a pic or something…

Read full topic

their both attack and death animations are good i tried killing them on another base it worked good.
Maybe i should give you some methods in the Npc .java?

item.source: [PI] Killing an npc makes the server crash

item.title: [PI] Killing an npc makes the server crash
item.dc:creator: @sspoke sspoke
item.description:
@sspoke wrote:

That code you posted has no way of crashing the server, but it may crash your client meaning your game will freeze up but the server will still be online. If thats not the case then you posted wrong code.

Only thing that could make your client crash is either the animation is wrong or doesn’t exist or the projectile is wrong or maybe client crashes when you send projectile or animation of negative one?

Need to test it out by making yourself into a npc by running the ::pnpc command

then coding or using existing commands like

::gfxtest -1
::gfxtest 872

and same for ::projectile -1 and 871 you need to probably specify some kind of target to test on then see what they do…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Killing an npc makes the server crash
item.dc:creator: @Pkor159 Pkor159
item.description:
@Pkor159 wrote:

Nvm it was just that i kill it at login.
It’s only penance queen. When i kill it it makes my server crash.
Here’s the code of it:

case 5247: // Penance queen int penance = Misc.random(1); if (penance == 0) { n.projectileId = 871; n.endGfx = 872; n.attackType = 1; } else { n.projectileId = -1; n.endGfx = -1; n.attackType = 0; } break;
I honestly don’t know what could be wrong with it…

Read full topic

Pkor159:

It closes too fast.

change your run.bat code from exit to pause.
